    <a href="/project/5697-open-source-bench-top-power-supply" class="item-link">
        <div title="Open Source Bench Top Power Supply by acp.calin" class="project-item-cover"
            
                    style="background-image:url('https://cdn.hackaday.io/images/resize/600x600/845501431113214930.jpg')"
                
            
        >

        </div>

        
                <div class="project-item-stats">
                    
                    
                        <span class="icon-view-count" title="View Count">813</span>
                    

                    <span class="icon-view" title="Followers">15</span>

                    
                        <span class="icon-comment-with-hover" title="Comments">0</span>
                    

                    
                        <span class="icon-skull" title="Skulls">4</span>
                    
                </div>
        

        <div class="project-item-title hasBadge">
            We start simple: with an open-source variable voltage power supply, which, for now, will use a modified computer PSU.

    <a href="/project/6713-low-cost-x-ray-lcxr" class="item-link">
        <div title="Low cost X-Ray (LCXR) by ArsenioDev" class="project-item-cover"

        >

        </div>

        
                <div class="project-item-stats">
                    
                    
                        <span class="icon-view-count" title="View Count">94</span>
                    

                    <span class="icon-view" title="Followers">10</span>

                        <span class="icon-skull" title="Skulls">3</span>
                    
                </div>
